Reviews.Title: “fantastic find!”
Reviews.Author: fire4efect
Reviews.Content: this was one of our best paris experiences...centrally located in montparmasse, the location cannot be beat for the price. the room was small, but we were on the highest floor of this boutique hotel and could glimpse the eiffel tower from the windows, great views! the room, albeit small, was very comfortable and the shower was exqiusite and modern. i know paris has been working on its image over the years, but the hotel staff were some of the nicest, cordial and most helpful ever encountered...do stay here, you will not be disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “A comoact but great base for Paris”
Reviews.Author: JuliefromBrisbane
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Apostrophe during February.  The rooms are very small - but the attention to detail is great.  The bathroom, shower, products, linen - all really high quality.  It's easy to find, and close to some great places to eat & drink.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: 123s
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in room D. The staff was very helpful with directions and suggestions for places to eat. The night attendant was particularly nice and full of suggestions. Try le cottage for dinner during your stay - it's across the street. We had a wonderful dinner. The location is also excellent. It's close to the metro and lots of restaurants and bars. The only drawback is that the rooms are on the small side (but they are really nice). Love the jets in the shower!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, in my opinion.”
Reviews.Author: Yilin T
Reviews.Content: Really tiny rooms. Artistic but barely enough space to get around. Good point was the free wifi but for the price, charging for breakfast felt a little like overkill. Location was good, near metro and the RER station. But coming from Rome where we got really outstanding service, the lack of basics (at least to us) like free tea/coffee making facilities and complimentary drinking water felt like glaring misses. Will definitely stay somewhere else the next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and more than what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Max N
Reviews.Content: I have zero complaints with my stay. I'll also say that a review of any travel experience is always measured against expectations. My expectation (and what I was looking for in a hotel) was a clean, boutique hotel in a convenient area in the latin quarter of Paris. All expectations were met and exceeded. Overall, I loved my stay, enjoyed the hotel and the staff, and would absolutely recommend the hotel without hesitation. Room: We stayed in the "Man" room symbolized by the upside down "A". The room was as advertised. Queen bed, very comfortable (not two twins, but a true queen). Large closet. As in other reviews, of note is that the shower and bathroom sink are a part of your room. I thought this was charming. It helped that the shower was incredible. The toilet is its own bathroom and is private. Staff: The staff were all exceptionally helpful. Someone at the desk 24/7. They had recommendations, made our reservations, called our room an hour before to ask if we needed taxis. When we came downstairs, they had maps printed to get us to our restaurants. Made the stay that much nicer. Also of note, I booked through Tablet.com. When I received my confirmation, I emailed and asked for as nice a room as possible (seemingly obvious but can't hurt) as every room at the Apostrophe is different. They were so accommodating, giving us the top floor room with a view. It was much appreciated. All in all, a great boutique hotel. Not for the people looking for amenity-driven hotels or luxury. But I wouldn't call it "no-frills" either. It was charming, very comfortable, modern and well appointed. But definitely a Paris Boutique hotel and not a luxury or chain-like establishment.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Megan O
Reviews.Content: A great location, walking distance to everything and close to the Metro. It's a funky, interesting hotel, each space depicting a peice of Paris history. Our room was tiny but cleverly designed. With a bit of discipline we were able to stow our gear and still walk around the bed (not over the top of it as with some Paris hotels!). I definitely need to comment on the shower. With multiple shower jets it's a heavenly way to refresh and relax at the end of a long day. English speaking staff were lovely, helpful and couldn't do enough for us in terms of recommendations of where to eat and what to see. Breakfast delivered to our room (for the same price as to eat downstairs) was an added bonus. We loved it and recommend it highly.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “No Need to Look Elsewhere in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan H
Reviews.Content: Simply the best hotel visit I've ever had. The staff was extremely helpful, and all were very kind and thoughtful. The room was beautiful, and even a little larger than I expected. The location was great; steps away from the Luxembourg Gardens and Catacombs tour. I didn't even need to use the Metro once, as all the major attractions were within walking distance. Fabulous neighborhood with restaurants, bakeries and shops. I would recommend this hotel to anyone; I'm returning with my family next spring and we can't wait! Believe all the great reviews of the Apostrophe!

Reviews.Title: “Hard act to follow”
Reviews.Author: EGGGIreland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a recent stay in the Apostrophe Hotel and it was fantastic. Before choosing the Apostrophe Hotel we had read all the reviews and as most were really good we thought we would take a chance on booking it. It was even better than we had expected. The customer service we experienced from ALL of the staff was superb. Help from the front desk was forthcoming 24/7 (re metro stops, directions, opening hours, places to eat etc etc). Location is great. Rer and metro stops only a few minutes walk away. The room was very clean and comfortable. The only thing we would have liked was a kettle. However this was not a problem as the staff at the front desk were very wiling to boil water for us at any stage day or night to make our own cup of tea. Well done to the Apostrophe staff you are setting a standard of service that all hotels should aspire to.

Reviews.Title: “Apostrophe Bliss”
Reviews.Author: Rasheda J
Reviews.Content: Everything about Apostrophe hotel is absolutely PERFECT! my husband and i were looking for a nice place for our last honeymoon night before heading home and this was more than what we expected. Fresh, clean room, wonderful design, fantastic view (we literally woke up to the sight of the tip of Eiffel Tower), convenient location and top notch service! What you see in their photos are exactly what you'll get. It's truly amazing!Thank you Isabelle, Laurent and Roman for making our stay so memorable! We hope to be back soon (and for more than one night next time)

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Zanotti-A-broad
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed at this property many times -- terrific location: down the street from Bon Marché, around the corner from the Luxembourg Gardens....... Friendly and helpful staff. Very clean property, fantastic Internet connection, terrific shower and good rooms.

Reviews.Title: “serene simplicity”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoNed
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights at Apostrophe and I would like to share that I enjoyed it. It is clean, serene, and the staff are just totally wonderful! Magnifique! My room, the Balneo, was by Paris standards good size, and definitely just enough for two people to share. But make sure it is ok for you to have a bath-tub in the room. The toilet is in a separate area (private) .The location is on the edge of the St Germain area (6th Arr) and is close by walking to some of the most popular areas in Paris. I would highly recommend Apostrophe. The Port Royal Station is just a 6 minute walk away, and other Metro stations are within 5 minutes too. The train ride from airport to Port Royal took about 45 mniutes, and the taxi ride is 35 minutes. For a bit of a non-touristy enjoyment, I very highly recommend walking in the next-door 14th Arrondisement especially along the Gaite streets and Daguerre streets, and the surrounding streets. There are lovely cafes, brasseries, restaurants (of all cuisines...asian, japanese, alsatian, turkish, italian...) creperies (I counted at least ten along one street next to Gaite St, all filled with happy people), markets, cute plazas, and just very very happy people! You'll feel like you are the only tourist among locals!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service, small room”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy452
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found Apostrophe Hotel (in the Calligraphy room)to be an excellent base for our short trip to Paris. We arrived at about 8am on an overnight flight from Asia so we very appreciative to be let into our room early. The room was very sleek and modern but tiny. We had to unpack our large suitcases and store them downstairs. The hotel staff were very welcoming; two of them spoke perfect english and the other very little. We tried the hotel breakfast one morning and found it to be very nice but generally found better value at one of the many nearby eateries. The area surrounding the hotel was lovely; we walked to all of the sites in central Paris but there is a Metro stop almost outside the hotel for those wanting public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little paradise in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jooph
Reviews.Content: The Apostophe Hotel is a wonderful small boutique hotel close to the Luxembourg gardens and St Germain. We had a delightful stay in the hotel for several reasons : the hotel has small room, but very tastefully decorated, and with smartly placed furniture. it also has great modern beds, unlike many other hotels in the same price bracket besides that it has great (rain)showers with good plumbing, so it feels like you are under a waterfall and lastly the location is excellent, within minutes from boulevard st germain, close to the luxembiur gardens and with the majestic restaurant la coupole at crawling distance.

Reviews.Title: “Simply a wonderful hotel experience--one worth repeating”
Reviews.Author: TomFromAlbany
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stayed at the Apostrophe and once again I was sad to leave because it is like my home in Paris. From the first minute I entered the door the staff made me feel fully welcome and valued. I was welcomed by Laurent who remembered me from my last visit. They had reserved the "Man" room, which I like because it is on the top floor and has a nice view. The rooms are not large, but the ambience and courtesy of the staff make this a rich and wonderful environment. The attention to detail and the environmental experience of the room (from color selection to lighting to selection of soaps and shampoo) are what make this hotel stand out as very special. Last year I stayed at the Hilton Paris hotel where I had a large luxurious, and wood-panelled but soulless room. I much prefer the Apostrophe with its carefully crafted hotel experience--the music system that lets you immerse yourself in your iphone tunes, the wonderful shower message, carefully planned color scheme and a bed that gives me a fantastic night's sleep. The location is perfect--quiet and almost residential, but close to the RER Airport line (10 min walk) and minutes away from three different Metro lines-giving you full access to all of Paris. On my next tripe to Paris my choice of hotels is simple--I will return to the Apostrophe. I strongly recommend this hotel to my friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, small room, reasonable bed, almost missed our flight”
Reviews.Author: Singafornian
Reviews.Content: I've been to Paris several times, and this place was definitely the most hospitable from an attitude perspective. It was the first time I've been to Paris and didn't feel like I was drastically inconveniencing the front desk clerk with the thoughtless need to check-in to the hotel. The rooms are quite small (smaller than other rooms in Paris), but the bed was probably the most comfortable I've had in Europe (meaning, it's about average for an American bed, but doesn't feel like you're on sheets wrapped over a board). Our room had the tiniest shower I've ever seen (even in Europe) with fancy jets spraying in many directions - conceptually it was fun, but in reality, the shower stall was a bit too small for that kind of spraying, and I ended up turning the water pressure really low to take a normal shower. Rooms were not great in terms of sound insulation, I was awakened several nights in a row by the neighboring people showering in the middle of the night. The location is good if you want to be in the Paris of Parisians - near Vavin, between the South gate of the Luxembourg gardens and Montparnasse. It's a fun area to walk around, and is more authentic than more touristy areas, yet is only about 15-20 minutes from Notre Dame. The Rive Gauche is by far my favorite location in Paris, and this place is very good for wandering around and finding cute, authentic, french-speaking restaurants and cafes (especially if you stay off the big streets). It's in a safe neighborhood (much, much better than anywhere in the north), and my BF and I felt safe walking around, even late at night. Also, it has GREAT metro access - some of the best in the city, because of its proximity to multiple major lines (it's less than a 10 min walk from Port Royal on blue, Notre Dame des Champs on green, and montparnasse on green). We were there for New Years, and ended up walking from the Eiffel tower because all the metro trains were full, which was do-able - it took about 45 minutes. The only complaint is that we almost missed our flight due to the lack of planning of the night front desk clerk. We asked the front desk clerk to call a taxi for the morning the night before, and told him the time of our flight and that we wanted the taxi at 8am (flight left at 10:40, 25 min drive to airport). He apparently didn't plan for it to be New Years, and when we headed downstairs at 8am, there was no taxi in sight. He and the morning clerk were frantically calling numbers, saying "don't worry, don't worry" and then discussing in French that they couldn't find a taxi to come. We didn't get a taxi until almost 9am, when they called a limo company (which we had to pay for). I understand that new years was an exception, but it is also an event that happens every year, always with the same results. Luckily it worked out, but we were very close to missing our flight, and as a small hotel they didn't seem to have any sway with taxi companies, the way a large hotel would.

Reviews.Title: “All that was expected and more!”
Reviews.Author: simonpwilkes
Reviews.Content: Very quirky hotel. Attention to detail is everything here. Very good interior design throughout. Roman was a star with friendly advice for Jazz clubs for New Year's eve etc. Well recommended. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Apostrophe in December”
Reviews.Author: PedroMig00
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Apostrophe in early December and we weren’t disappointed. The room is exactly as advertised, will all the nice features such as LCD TV, HiFi, walk in shower, fibre optic lights in the ceiling, etc .. If you’re arriving from CDG Airport it’s conveniently located close to a RER station (Port Royal), and it’s one minute walk from a Metro Station (Vavin) that leaves you right in city centre. During the several days we’ve stayed the staff was always helpful and the room was always cleaned thoroughly each day. The only remark is that we were allocated the only room in the ground floor (was not aware that there was one), which I found was a bit awkward. Obviously this room is the noisiest because it’s just next to reception and you could hear any noise coming from the street. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent base for adventures...”
Reviews.Author: Ladywriter83
Reviews.Content: The Apostrophe is perfectly placed between 4 metro stations so it's ideal for getting around. The local area is not touristy and full of little shops - especially children's shops - to browse. The staff are incredibly helpful and friendly. Our room ("Musique") was incredibly comfortable and pleasant, though small-ish (as I think is usually the case in Paris unless you have bottomless pockets).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simone340
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Apostrophe was a fantastic place to stay. I was there for over a week and ended up staying there an extra night on my way back to Australia. Roman and Isabelle made our stay a breeze. They were so pleased to help us with a multitude of things - laundry, endless metro explanations, tours, places to eat, etc. They were both friendly and incredibly professional and we felt welcomed everytime we walked in to the hotel. The rooms are also really cool and modern - each room has a different theme. We stayed in the Music Room - with cool piano keys on the roof. We had twin beds and for Paris there was plenty of room and a good view of the street. Breakfast was excellent value too and yummy! When it came time to say goodbye - it felt like saying goodbye to new found friends. A wonderful experience and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, central and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Anders F
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed twice at the Apostrophe Hotel. And both times have been really good experiences. Yes, the rooms are relatively small - it is Paris after all - but the interior is utilized very well and the location of the hotel is second to none. However, the strongest selling point for the hotel is the excellent service. You really feel at home in these surroundings. If there is anything the staff can do to help you, they will. I can only give the strongest recommendations for this hotel after my stays.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jarmo R
Reviews.Content: I just stayed 3 nights in Apostrophe hotel in Paris. It was my second visit within a year. This time I was on business trip. Apostrophe is really a wonderful hotel and meeting my criteria for a business as well as for pleasure. It is small (16 rooms), it is clean, well located (RER train station only 3-4 minutes walk away. But most importantly the staff in the hotel is really top class. They are not only extremely friendly but they also feel like being home. All the rooms are different. They are small in size but very functional. Everything what you need is there. And the breakfast service is very personal and nice. Special thanks to Gino who works on the night shift. He is just a great guy :)

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel that will always remind us of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jaspreet G
Reviews.Content: My wife and me stayed here in November 1st week for 5 nights and it was a very nice experience. The hospitality, ambience, close to everything, and a very friendly english speaking staff complemented it all. The rooms are a little small when you first come to this hotel, but it soon gets compensated with a smiling friendly staff, Hydo-Shower bathroom, comfy bed and an awesome breakfast. It is truly a great boutique hotel offering. Ask for Roman and he will guide you to everything in the Hotel. They also got our taxi reservation deposit refunded. That caring touch was icing on the cake...:). Will definitely stay here next time in Paris without thinking twice.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bridget G
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful boutique hotel in a perfect Parisian neighborhood. Clean, reasonably quiet rooms while being only a few steps away from the vibrant Boul'Mich and rue de Montparnasse; good subway access; terrific spa-style shower. The staff are all helpful and accommodating -- providing baggage assistance, directions, a taxi, an adapter for my laptop charger (which was a real lifesaver). All in all, a great spot -- I can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful Paris Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: LINYdeb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 5 nights at this wonderful, quiet, clean hotel in the left bank near the Luxembourg gardens. The rooms were clean, bright and comfortable. We arrived from NY early in the morning. Our room was not ready due to the fact that the hotel was fully booked the night before. We left our luggage with the concierge, had a cup of coffee in the small breakfast area and walked through the Luxembourg Gardens and to Notre Dame. Our room was ready around 12:30 and being that we were exhausted from the overnight flight, we took a nap. Without us having to ask, the concierge gave us a wake up call to remind us we had a 7:30 dinner reservation. We came down to the lobby and he had printed out a google map with directions on how to get to the restaurant. This was just a small example of how caring and helpful the staff was at this hotel. The hotel was a few blocks walk to 3 different metro stops which made traveling around Paris very easy. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: dylanroberts
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to paris and felt i had to add to these reviews, all i can say is it's perfect, People have commented on the size of the rooms, yes they are not massive, but they are not that small either, the shower and beds are amazing, clean, and warm. The location is in a nice quiet street just off a great boulevard full of bars and cafe's. The biggest plus are the staff, Roman, Geno and Jean where super helpful, willing to book things ahead for us, advise on local restaurants and cafes, and what metro/bus routes where the best. I look forward to returning to this great little hotel, that made me feel right at home for my first stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “By far, the best!”
Reviews.Author: Knighto
Reviews.Content: What can I say? in a 5 week trip covering Germany, Prague, Holland the UK and France. This is by far the best hotel we stayed in. We arrived early one morning after a bus trip from the UK. Expecting to maybe just leave our bags for check in later only to find that our room was ready! Once in the room which is quite large for Paris standards it was awesome! We stayed in the 'Book' room and loved every bit of it. The shower and bed are by far the best feature, containing a very comfy queen bed and an excellent massage shower, we had no problems relaxing in one of the most beautiful cities on the planet. I can't recommend the staff any higher as they were always ready to help even with a coffee on arrival for us weary travellers! Any people complaining about the bathroom 'OPEN' it’s all cool. The Toilet is completely self-contained in a room and the shower has a big glass shower screen to stop any water getting into the room. I think it’s a great feature! A stay here you will not regret. Thanks Apostrophe for making Paris even more special!

Reviews.Title: “Apostrophe Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CCMLi
Reviews.Content: A very well maintained and clean hotel with excellent service and fun, unique rooms. Internet worked very well, and breakfast is available (though I didn't try it). The staff are extremely helpful and everyone speaks very good English. The location is also very convenient, especially if you're travelling to/from Charles de Gaulle airport (straight shot on the RER B to Port Royal and a 5 minute walk on a road with wide sidewalks). I gave a "very good" for sleep quality because I like a harder mattress, but that's just personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “For a great couples experience in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: dinka1
Reviews.Content: We shopped around for a special 3 day Paris stay, and went a bit over budget to stay here. We are very glad we did! The location was perfect, and the room was as tastefully done as any room we have ever stayed in, anywhere. OK, small by Texas standards, but just perfect for our needs. The decor, the 7 nozzle shower, the great sound system... No "hotel fatigue" as usually happens on the third night. Best of all was the friendly And highly professional staff. What a treat! You get what you pay for, and this hotel is worth every euro. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: LimKH
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Apostrophe hotel for our honeymoon in Paris for 4 nights. Found this hotel via tripadvisor, with many positive reviews. This little boutique hotel exceeded our expectations! We were given a warm welcome by the staff who were always so eager to help. Though the room given to us (Room "S") was a little small (but what can you expect in Paris?), it was clean, neatly arranged and nicely decorated. They have different rooms with different themes. The hotel also placed red petals on the bed in the shape of a heart to welcome us! Fantastic location, just a few metres away from Vavin metro station which is accessible to most parts of Paris and its attractions. It's also near the Luxembourg gardens for those who wants some place to relax. This boutique hotel is not in the "touristy" area of Paris, its surrounded by little cafes and Paris eateries and makes you feel like you are living like a Parisien and one can travel safely out even at night. They also provided free wifi! Only let down was room was not really sound proof. Could hear the person in the next room coughing the whole night. Overall a great stay. Would recommend it to honeymooners as well. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: tyreke
Reviews.Content: - Very friendly and helpful staff. Roman is particularly great. Although one time we needed to make a reservation at a restaurant which was apparently made but when we got to the restaurant they didn't have our reservation. Maybe something got lost in translation. - Rooms are clean, quiet and easy to get rest in. I knew they were going to be small but they really are and I've stayed at a few Paris designer hotels. But for the price (we paid 200 euro) you're not going to get any better than this. Free wifi. - Location: Not right in the thick of the action (ie where the tourists are) but in a nice residential part of the 6th. Local cafes and patisserie a 3 minute walk. Train station 4 minute walk and on a very main line that takes you straight into Place de la concorde, madalene etc. This place fit in for what we wanted. We'd been to Paris before and had a few meetings to attend. We didn't want to spend 350 euros to be right in the thick of it ie. St Germain Blvd or Champs. For 200 euro this place is great. I wish I could give it 5 stars but I felt it wasn't perfect in terms of location and room size (close but not quite). 5 star service and 4 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fantastic staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: tea-babe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 6 nights at this hotel as an anniversary celebration. We stayed in the "musique" room pictured in the profile. The hotel's location is very convenient -- near the Jardin du Luxembourg and the Montparnasse Cemetery, several good restaurants, quiet at night. There's a metro stop about 5 minutes away. The hotel has been hand-painted throughout, with a great deal of care and attention paid to detail. Our room was lovely, well-appointed with everything we would need. The only criticism I would have is that the room was extremely small -- it was a bit like a game of Tetris anytime we wanted to move anything. I would recommend unpacking your bags and storing them downstairs while you stay. We made it work but it was a little tricky. Other than that, the room was very comfortable and we slept well. The staff was truly exceptional. Everyone at the front desk was pleasant and helpful, and we sincerely enjoyed talking with them. They recommended Chez Fernand, the restaurant on the corner of Rue de Chevreuse and Avenue de Montparnasse, and they were absolutely right -- it was great. Also recommended is Le Timbre, just a few minutes' walk from the hotel. We really liked this hotel. It was a bit of a splurge for us and is definitely not cheap, especially for such a small room. But Paris is a big city where prices are high and real estate is limited, so I think the price is appropriate for this market. The service was excellent and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great great service. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Natness
Reviews.Content: Blessed with a funky interior apostrophe has an excellent level of service and a great location, close to cafes/restaurants and a small walk or metro ride into any of the Paris sights. Only thing is that the rooms were not very soundproof.

Reviews.Title: “Staff makes all the difference!”
Reviews.Author: JellyfishSingapore
Reviews.Content: My review of this hotel is mixed. For me, the room's facilities and comfort is the most important criteria in any hotel. On my first night, I was given a room with a "jacuzzi spa" kind of bath tub. The bath was not separated by shower curtains and offers absolutely no privacy. You need to restrict your movements if you do not want water to get splashed everywhere. It did not work for me at all and I knew that the room was going to ruin my 5 nights stay. Luckily, the staff transferred me to another room with a “rain shower” concept the next day. The room was smaller but the layout was much better and I was looking forward to bath time each day. We had a little Eiffel view and that was a bonus! I feel obliged to mention the minus points of this hotel: - There is no mini bar/fridge - No disposable slippers - We had to fold up the chairs to accommodate our luggage i.e. there is no place to sit on except your bed - English T.V. channels are limited to CNBC, BBC – no movie channels What makes this hotel great is its staff. The team seems genuinely interested to know what you were planning to do each day, work out your full day itinerary for you - if you wish, and simply make it their duty to ensure that you explore Paris to its fullest – which we did!

Reviews.Title: “Apostrophe Hotel - Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kpalmer1974
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel tastefully decorated and had lots of character as it was designed by a photographer/designer so it had a lot of quirky little extras to discover around the lobby and in the rooms. The staff was fantastic, super nice and accommodating. The location was terrific as its easily accessible to all of Montparnasse, walking distance to the Seine, St.Germain and Latin Quarter and a metro line one block away. Rooms are tiny, but that similar with most boutique hotels in Paris so this shouldn't be a deal breaker for any traveller. My room was just off the lobby (which I requested) as it was the biggest and I found it just perfect. The only thing I didn't enjoy too much was the open concept shower, as water got everywhere. But, I would definitely stay here again and give the hotel the highest recommendations! Its a lovely hotel, with lovely staff. :)

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, with perfect staff”
Reviews.Author: Greensmoothie
Reviews.Content: We stayed only 3 nights in this hotel. The staff are fantastic and make staying in this hotel a wonderful experience. My thanks to Roman and the owner whose name escapes me, Your help was so appreciated. Also Jean Pierre. Yes this hotel is small and yes when we walked into our room with the two beds pushed together, we just re-arranged the room to suit. Yes, the bathroom/shower is open to the room but once again, you either turn the other cheek, or leave the room if you are not traveling with your beloved. It's just not that hard to make this hotel work for you. My friend is diabetic and because of space issues there was no minibar in the room and when we asked within a few minutes the cutest little fridge was delivered to our room. I recommend this little hotel highly. Robyn, Melbourne Australia

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of what the room will or will not have.”
Reviews.Author: USATravelDC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a charming place with lovely staff. Now, let me tell you the basic issue: The room. First we were shown a room in which the shower was clear glass and located literally in the room. The second room we were offered had no bath. The third room -- the one we took -- was off of the lobby. While the door to the room is quite heavy and insulated, you will still hear sounds from the lobby, meaning they will hear sounds from your room. Additionally, the room was explained as a room with two beds. The room did have two beds, but they were twin beds pushed together to make one king sized bed. The room was so small they could not be separated. The location is great. Convenient to Luxembourg Gardens and a lovely walk to the Metro station which also serves the RER trains. It wasn't cheap, but from what I hear, that is a Paris thing... Highly priced hotels. PS: From here we went to Madrid... Paris is great, but Madrid was amazing. Much better on the wallet and a wonderful vibe. Far better time than in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Staff, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Nancy852
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at the beginning of September. I had a overnight flight and was delighted to find my room ready when I arrived at 10:00a.m. Was greeted by Roman who was so cheerful and helpful throughout my stay. The room was a fair size with the jacuzzi style bathtub within the room. The hotel is close to many metro lines the RER and Luxembourg Gardens. The hotel is lovely and quiet and the staff are really committed to customer service. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: FunandSunNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with a friend at the end of our trip to Paris. The Apostrophe hotel is tucked away on a quiet side street in the Montparnasse district. When we arrived we received a warm welcome from Roman who was exceedingly friendly and helpful. Our room was small and the sink/shower were exposed (as others have mentioned) but it wasn't an inconvenience. The hotel was very clean and quiet. The free wifi and flat screen tv were nice perks. Very cute hotel but it's not as practical or comfortable as some other hotels in Paris. Works well for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTrave1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights in August. Staff were very friendly. Room was very small (but typical Paris/European room size, I'd say) and everything seemed new and clean. Shower and sink were open to the room, toilet was behind a door though (but it was not a surprise or anything, it says it right on the website). The jet/rain shower was awesome. Wifi included was great. Five minute walk to the RER B was convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Superb!”
Reviews.Author: will39
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for 5 nights and everything was perfect. The location is perfect and very close to 3 different metro stops. The decor is charming and the staff was so helpful and made some wonderful dinner suggestions. We never hesitated to ask them questions because they were all so warm and friendly. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. It was a perfect choice. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Location and Design”
Reviews.Author: Luca M
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The rooms are typically small but very well designed and comfortable. Suited for couples. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is very good: quiet, near metro station and a lot of bistros and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Made our honeymoon "perfect"”
Reviews.Author: McG1973
Reviews.Content: John and I picked Paris and the Apostrophe Hotel for our honeymoon, we were not let down by either. After getting the train connection from the airport, our first impression of this beautiful city was walking along rue Montparnasse. The hotel a short five minute walk away made this very easy. Instantly we fell in love with the city and the hotel. The staff were friendly and welcoming and there to help whenever advice was needed. The hotel although small was perfectly set out, it was arty, quirky and romantic helped by the top floor view of the Eiffel Tower which twinkled each night. The space is enough for a couple and the beds incredibly comfortable. The area itself was what made the holiday, it was a lovely part of Paris with lots of good bars, bistros and restaurants. Also the Gardens du Luxembourg were amazing, a perfect place to chill out and watch life go by. The metro makes it very easy to get around as there is much to see. Although we chose not to eat at the hotel because we had so much to do, we can recommend the Marco Polo tea which was a must after long days. I will not forget my first time in Paris and the hotel had a big part to play in this. Believe me I will be pestering my new husband to take me back, the sooner the better.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave!!”
Reviews.Author: 2John
Reviews.Content: Great little designer hotel in a good location in Paris. Perfect for couples, there are plenty of bars, bistros and restaurants in the surrounding area but from here the rest of the city is easily accessible from nearby metro stations. Hotel staff were brilliant, very helpful and ready to offer advice on where to go, bookings and general advice on the city. We loved our room which was on the top floor with a rooftop view of Paris and the Eiffel Tower. The rooms are small but very well thought out and designed and have everything you could want. Will be back whenever we get the chance!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca S
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was perfect. The location (quiet and yet central), the super friendly staff, the lovely clean rooms and the amazing shower!

Reviews.Title: “We'll definately stay here each time we visit Paris”
Reviews.Author: RussandJane
Reviews.Content: Our trip was a present from me to my fiance and I wanted to find somewhere to stay that would be easy to navigate from, in a not too touristy area, that was also an interesting place to stay in and of itself and the Apostrophe ticked every box. We flew in to Charles de gaulle and then caught the train to Port Royal on the RER line B. Gare Du Nord is on the same line, so its equally as easy to access if catching the euro star. Its then a quick 5 minute walk up Boulevard de Montparnasse to Rue de Chevreuse, where the Apostrophe Hotel awaits you. When you are navigating your way around Paris, Vavin metro stop is right near by as are a number of bus lines and the RER port royal station, I'd definately recommend making use of public transport in Paris. The lovely Isabelle, took us up to our room and showed us all the features and how everything worked. We stayed in the calligraphie room on the second floor, beautiful blue which you might assume from the pictures on the website is all over the room but its focused on the bedhead and curtains so is not overwhelming. Yes, the rooms are relatively small if you're used to the size of hotel rooms in the US or Middle east but its really all the space you need. If you had a lot of luggage I'm sure you could keep the empty cases in the hotels luggage store or under the bed to save space. We had a shower in our room which was amazing. Fantastic water preassure and every kind of shower configuration you could imagine, overhead monsoon shower head, shower jets for when you want to feel like you're in a car wash and a hand held shower attachment for when it all feels a bit too much and you just want to keep it simple. I never had a problem with water getting out of the shower as some of the other reviewers have, so I can certainly vouch for the Calligraphie room shower being contained well and water tight. We opted for breakfast in bed each morning, I had the apostrophe breakfast, 2 mini pastries, beautiful bread, jams, honey and nutella, choice of a hot drink and fresh fruit juice. Russ had the tonic breakfast, yoghurt, cereal, fresh fruit, fruit juice and a hot drink. Both were lovely choices and the quality of the food was very high. Definately kept us going each day. We both loved the juices and Russ especially loved the green tea with vanilla. Service from everyone at the hotel was excellent, we saw Isabelle and Gino the most and would have great chats with him when we'd get home of an evening about where we had been and where we were planning to head the next day. Really genuinely lovely people that we enjoyed seeing as we headed out and came in each day. Thank you to everyone at the Apostrophe, especially Isabelle and Gino, for making our trip so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Parisian Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Carla J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our Honeymoon in Paris, where we stayed all 10 nights at Apostrophe Hotel. I have lived abroad in both Latin America and Italy, and was expecting Paris to be have a difficult time following either in my mind and heart. I have to say, thanks to the fast friendship of the kind and thoughtful staff at the Apostrophe Hotel, Paris exceeded all of our expectations. To be honest, i even teared up a little after we said goodbye to the staff! The rooms, though typically small, are chic and modern and the whirlpool bath is quite sexy. The building and amenities were a pleasure to return to each night; very clean and comfortable. Well worth the money! Laurent and Roman at the front desk are particularly charming and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: DWE51
Reviews.Content: The hotel was centrally located for our purposes. Of gratest importance was the friendliness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel; very friendly and helpful service”
Reviews.Author: rjgarnold
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for 2 weeks. Great location close to Blvd Montparnasse. 10-minute walk to RER-B metro, which goes to airport, cafes, shopping. They were very accommodating for my elderly parents and all front desk staff, especially Isabelle (the proprietress), were charming. Not good if you're looking for a Marriott, but if you want a "French" experience, this place was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!”
Reviews.Author: annof2manyhorses
Reviews.Content: I loved this little botique hotel! I found it on the Tablet website and couldn't have been happier. The location was perfect; easy walking distance to many sights, with great restaurants close by. I LOVED the decor, and breakfast was really tasty too! Fabulous!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing. One of the best places I have ever stayed in. Perfect for couples!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dejan13
Reviews.Content: Couples will love this place. The rooms are amazing. Small, but so cozy and lovely!! A must go for life!!

Reviews.Title: “great experience - we hope to return”
Reviews.Author: movementaddict
Reviews.Content: We loved L'apostrophe! The rooms were stylish and clean, and best of all- the staff was friendly and very helpful. The reception was warm and the staff helped us by suggesting restaurants, directions, and confirming reservation and calling taxis. We felt well-cared for, and welcome. The neighborhood is residential, but there are many options for food around the hotel. It is convenient to the metro (which is very easy to use) and on a line that goes directly to some of the big tourist sites in Paris. It is also easy to walk from this hotel to main tourist areas in Paris. It is very close to the Jardin du Luxembourg, which must be one of the most beautiful gardens in the world! And to walk to the Louvre, one need only to walk north on the BLVD Raspail to Rue de Bac and cross Pont Royal ( about 3 Km.) We did this several times day and night and always we felt safe walking. We liked the neighborhood very much. I tried very hard to practice my French- but no worries- the staff spoke English so there were not problems. The breakfast for 7.5 euros was good: coffee, baguette, a small pain au chocolat and a small croissant (per person.) One may order additional items. The juice (extra) was freshly pressed and delicious. They prefer to serve breakfast in the room, as there is not much room for all the hotel guests to eat in the lobby. The soap and amenities smell great. Two warnings: 1) as is common in Europe, the rooms are small to American standards. However, they will store luggage for you if you want to unpack. We did this and it worked well. 2) the street-side rooms can be loud, but when we had the windows closed it was fine. There are many big hotels in tourist areas in Paris- but when I return, and I hope to do so- I will choose this warm, friendly and trendy boutique hotel in the quiet neighborhood again! it makes the trip extra-special.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best of Class in Area”
Reviews.Author: LAPlatinum
Reviews.Content: I elected this hotel over a cheesy Holiday Inn where my conference was being held and am I glad I did. This beautiful boutique hotel is close to both the Metro and the RER, and as I had heavy luggage, this was of benefit. I arrived in a torrential deluge early one morning--hours before official check-in--and I was in my room within a few minutes. I had the Music Room (as all rooms are themed) and while tiny, it was beautifully appointed. I was not bothered by the combo bathroom/bedroom situation but was concerned that there was a mold and small water damage problem at the shower's edge which was, quite frankly, incongruous with the pristine nature of the rest of the room. As several other guests have commented, the staff are amazingly helpful and will patiently print maps and make sure you have everything you need to be comfortable. A lot of wonderful restaurants are close by (try le bar a huitres if you LOVE seafood) and you are but a few minutes' walk from the Luxembourg Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “A unique boutique hotel with stellar service!”
Reviews.Author: Geofferson M
Reviews.Content: Located centrally in District 6, we recently stayed at the Apostrophe Hotel in our first ever visit to Paris.  We booked the reservation through Tablet Hotels, which featured this boutique hotel for its PLUS members.  This hotel is very small, with only a few dozen rooms and tucked away on a side street close to a busy tourist area with lots of restaurants nearby.  Upon arrival we were greeted by a very friendly woman named Isabelle (who turned out to be the owner) and promptly checked us in.  The room was unique, clean and very small (but we expected this after being in Europe for a week already) with a LIGHT themed room!  We enjoyed playing with the lights which created really cool shadows!  Later we found out, all the rooms have their own unique themes.  The hotel is very quiet except you may be awaken by the garbage trucks early in the morning.  As part of the Tablet PLUS promotion, we were allowed early check in, a daily refresh of Parisian chocolates, a complimentary bottle of champagne and free WI-FI.  If you need internet access for more than 1 device, just ask at the lobby and you can extra codes.  They honoured everything mentioned without any problems.  We had heard not to expect great service in Paris and this was true for some of the places, but the staff at Apostrophe was the exception, especially Gino.  They offers lots of suggestions for places to eat, things to do and tips on how to get around.  If they didn't know an answer, they looked it up.  A huge tip we got from Isabelle was the Paris Museum Pass, which for a fixed price (either for a 2 or 4 day pass) gets you access to the top museums, art and historical venues. One thing that took some getting used to, was giving the room key to the front desk every time you leave and asking for it back, upon return.  We were told this was a Paris thing though. From the hotel, you can walk to a beautiful park (Jardin du Luxembourg), a shopping mall and lots of cafes and restaurants.  The metro station is 5 mins away and it is about 30 mins walk to Notre Dame and a popular public square Place St. Michel and the Catacombs (a must-see but not included with the Museum). While this is my only hotel experience in Paris I would definitely recommend Apostrophe if you cherish boutique experiences, want personal service and seek good value!

Reviews.Title: “Cool concept & great people”
Reviews.Author: DebB82
Reviews.Content: My teenage girls and I stayed here while on vacation. The staff was incredibely helpful with details of where to go and how to get there. The rooms are very clean and unique! We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Very well situated and nicely furbished”
Reviews.Author: JNP28691
Reviews.Content: In a quiet street close to the busy part of Montparnasse, the hotel is very well located close to the Luxembourg gardens. Our room was quite small but comfortable. Desk clerk was very helpful. Good address

Reviews.Title: “TREMENDOUS!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Picklesncheese
Reviews.Content: You need to book this now. It's just that simple. We have never had such an incredible experience staying at a hotel. The rooms and location are incredible but what really sets these guys apart is the outstanding service. They will jump through hoops for you. Do it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Paris for a Mother-Daughter Trip”
Reviews.Author: jmw_ct
Reviews.Content: Convenient location near Jardin du Luxembourg, charming bistros and several Metro stops. Excellent friendly service! Stylish decor and fantastic showers. Small-ish rooms, but don't let that stop you from staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: asharb
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough about this hotel. The location is fantasic, within easy walking distance of pretty much everything on the Left Bank and the Louvre. The location is also within a very short walk of the RER from CDG, Gard du Montparnasse (should you wish to take an easy day trip to Chartres), and a number of different Metro lines, making travel throughout Paris a breeze. The hotel staff is excellent and unbelievably friendly. While the rooms are not large, the large casement windows in each room open fully giving a feeling of spaciousness, so that we never once found ourselves wanting for additional space. We especially appreciated the high end fixtures and designer touches in the room. We also appreciated that our room was very clean, the linens crisp, and the bed comfortable. As mentioned by others, the shower was exceptional with it's 6 side jets, spray wand and rain shower head. Another bonus at this hotel is complementary wifi, which saved at least 10 euros per day over the hotel we orignally planned to stay in. The best part about this hotel is the proximity to wonderful restaurants. Rue Montparnasse is about 25 yds from the hotel and there are many eateries to choose from on this street, from patisseries, to bistros (try the Asian fusion bistro across the street), to classic French restaurants. Because you are staying in a vibrant neighborhood, you never really feel like a tourist. We look forward to coming back to this area and this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at good location”
Reviews.Author: chatlas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in a short and busy Paris weekend. Perfect location och very quiet rooms. the staff was friendly and helpful and the interior of the hotel was very nice. Perfect hotel for a Paris weekend!

Reviews.Title: “By far, the best place we've stayed in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: BJF52
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderfully unique hotel, with the most helpful staff I have ever encountered in a hotel -- in Paris or elsewhere. It is on a quiet street, and is about a 10 minute walk from Jardin du Luxembourg. The Metro is a 5-minute walk, and the RER B line to the airport is a 10 minute walk. This is a small hotel, and all of the rooms are designed in a different motif. Although the rooms are on the small side, they are not atypical for Paris, and I've stayed in smaller rooms. Staff in the lobby are always welcoming, and you feel as if you're staying in a home rather than a hotel. The rooms are comfortable, very creatively designed, and impeccably clean. The staff are remarkably friendly and consistently helpful. Regardless of where I have to be in Paris, I'd go out of my way to stay at the Apostrophe Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME, AWESOME, AWESOME!!!!”
Reviews.Author: michel666
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel that is extremely well located in Paris. You are right by major metro and within a few stops of all major attractions/musuems. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. We felt very very welcomed there. Their showers are incredible, multiple shower heads, massage setting... the works!!!! I will absolutely be back to stay there again and again. THANK YOU APOSTROPHE HOTEL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and chic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: SparksL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Apostrophe Hotel for 5 nights in May. While the rooms are small, they are very comfortable and well-designed, with high-end touches. For example, the room had one of the best showers I have ever had in any hotel. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, and the location was ideal for us. The hotel is just blocks from the lovely Jardin Luxembourg and surrounded by lots of cafes and restaurants, but on a quiet alley, which makes it feel like a peaceful retreat from the city. Great value, would recommend to anyone looking for a boutique hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A honeymoon they helped make perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ford13
Reviews.Content: The room was a little small, but the way it was laid out with mirrors and large windows allowed me to forget the size very fast. It also helped that they somehow knew it was our honeymoon and had a heart made of flower pedals on the bed waiting when we checked in with jazz playing lightly in the background, it was a really nice touch for us. Then I saw the shower and after the shower of our last hotel (which was having water problems) it was paradise. We actually took pictures of it so when we buy a house we can do something similar. The staff was so friendly and helpful, I would have to say the best we encountered on our whole European trip. I would go back and stay again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Individuality”
Reviews.Author: exilon
Reviews.Content: Apostrophe Hotel has a genuine atmosphere, with firendly and helpful staff that made our stay a memorable one. The rooms are uniquely designed and we could even see the Eiffel Tower from the window. Allthough small and slightly claustrophobic, it suited our need for a romantic stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in downtown and away from the messy parts.”
Reviews.Author: flappo8
Reviews.Content: Easy check in procedure and we were able to head to our room early after an overnight flight from the states. The location was easy to get to and away from the more touristy and urban areas of paris (Montmartre, etc...) The staff were extremely friendly and helped us plan everything we needed from using wirless and borrowing a house net book for our room, to directions, and restraunt locations that had numerous options. Beautifully decorated hotel from the outside to the deep inside.

Reviews.Title: “Simply THE best hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: HelenN_11
Reviews.Content: This is genuinely the best, most friendly and most charming hotel in Paris. I have stayed in many of all differing costs and quality and without doubt this is the only hotel I would ever want to stay in when visiting this beautiful city. The staff are all so friendly and helpful and make you feel so welcome. The rooms are amazing! Yes they are like many city rooms smaller than average but none are as well commissioned as these. So well thought out - no detail has been missed. Set down a quiet side street in probably one of the best areas of the city. So easy to access from G De Galle airport via the RER 3 mins walk and a minute from the Metro with easy access to the rest of the city. The restaurants in the area are bountiful and of such amazing quality. Le Rotunde is so friendly and brilliant value many visits had to be made back. For a really special evening try La Closerie des Lilas - simply the best meal I have ever eaten.

Reviews.Title: “L'Apostrophe; c'est fantastique!”
Reviews.Author: GianOrso
Reviews.Content: The week I've spent in Paris has been unforgettable, for many different reasons and sensations. Certainly the Apostrophe Hotel has been a winning choice. I really liked the design of the hotel and, of course, of my room ("L" as "Livre", "Book", where all the decoration was based on the theme of writing and culture), not very big, but good for two people, and with a magnificent shower with hydro-massage. Another good aspect is the fact of having the metro stop Vavin at just 5 minutes walk far from the hotel. The guys at the concierge of the hotel are ultra-kind and always ready to answer and help for any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice room, good location, some minor tweaks could help”
Reviews.Author: bling23
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Apostrophe Hotel overall was very good. We spent 3 nights in the room directly off the front desk, which we were told was one of the larger rooms. While it was still small in our view, considering it is Paris, the space was adequate. We were initially concerned about the noise from the lobby, but that turned out to be a non-issue as the door has been sound proofed - nice touch! We were also worried about street noise as the window faces the street, but the windows and shutters block out all noise so well that we slept in quite late everyday. The only issue we had with the room was the shower, which is essentially the entire bathroom as there is no shower curtain or tub. When taking showers, we struggled to not flood the entire space. Perhaps a simple shower curtain could help contain the water? The best part of our stay by far though was the staff who were friendly, cheerful, and extremely helpful. It made our stay so enjoyable and relaxed. We were a bit surprised that the coffee we consumed each morning appeared to be free, but then we were charged for it when we checked out - perhaps some warning would help here. Overall though, the hotel is located in a good location, the rooms are clean, wifi is free, and the staff is quite friendly. We would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel for those who plan on spending a lot of time out sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoRMK
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice. Modern, clean, and the location was fantastic. The room we stayed in was small, but we didnt travel 4500 miles to sit around in a hotel room, therefore it was no big deal. The bathrooms were new and clean. Water pressure was excellent. The staff, in particular Laurent, was wonderful. Kind, helpful and, for those of us who dont speak French, able to speak English. We would return just for how helpful and kind the staff was. Location, as mentioned above, was great. Within walking distance of numerous numerous eatiers, bars, and a nice wine shop conveintly located under the street

Reviews.Title: “Quiet comfortable friendly in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Rose190776
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff made our stay even more relaxed. Very comfortable and interesting themed room. Quiet and in good location for exploring Paris. Getting to and from CDG airport via RER (Port Royal) was straightforward. Lots of choice for walking and using metro all over Paris.

Reviews.Title: “First class staff set this hotel apart”
Reviews.Author: da_lloyd
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small (the reason for rating slightly less than excellent) but well appointed and clean; the relatively quiet street front provides for a restful night's sleep. It's the staff that set this hotel apart.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish yet affordable”
Reviews.Author: MichaelandMaria
Reviews.Content: Apostrophe is a very nice little hotel with a friendly attentive staff. It's a short walk from St Germaine and museums along the Seine and a great value. The rooms are small but well appointed and full of interesting finishes and design touches.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, small and bijoux with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: 777pj777
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights over a weekend. It's new, with modern amenitites. The rooms are "compact" but very well appointed and the staff on reception are very friendly and helpful. It's round the corner from two Metro stops so getting around is no problem. There are also lots of good bars and restaurants situated within easy walking distance of the hotel. Good value for a real quirky place!

Reviews.Title: “Great botique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jhoc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a trendy boutique just off the main street. The rooms are individually decorated with artist work which is a nice change. The street we faced out on was very quiet so there was no noise or problems sleeping at night. The room is not large but more than adequate especially for city hotel standards. The staff at the desk were very helpful and charming and took a real interest in our activities and helping us out which was great. The location is a few minutes walk from a metro station and a 15 min walk to Luxembourg Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “trendy style, excellent location, extremely friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: picky_and_discerning
Reviews.Content: Paris is one of the trickiest places to be sure of value for money when one pays for a hotel, but the Apostrophe ticks all the boxes and more. If you want a central location (left bank, surrounded by great book stores, cafes, direct RER to Charles de Gaulle and another metro stop, Vavin, virtually at its doorstep), AND individualistic style, you can't do much better. The breakfast was excellent, internet was free, really friendly and helpful staff at all hours of day and night, and strong style statements that made best use of available space. Thoroughly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, convenient location, and lovely room for a perfect Parisian getaway with your spouse”
Reviews.Author: TCCNYC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 5 days at the Apostrophe Hotel for her birthday. It was her first time in Paris and neither of us spoke French but fortunately our wonderful conciegers (Roman & Laurent) were able to speak English while also trying to teach us some survival French along the way. From the time we made reservations the staff was very accomodating and even allowed us early access to the room as our flight came in a bit early. Throughout the trip they provided excellent recommentations for dinner and even made reservations for us. All the places allowed us to experience traditional French cuisine on days we wanted someting cheap to nights we wanted to splurge a bit. It was ablsolutely perfect. The hotel truly made us feel like it was a home away from home and melted any fears we had of coming to Paris without speaking the language. In addition to the amazing staff the location of the hotel is within walking distance to cafes, parks, Metro, and shopping. One bit of advice, please explore the streets around the hotel as there a number of great hidden shops that we unfortunately only discovered the last day of the trip. But overall, my wife and felt the experience exceed our expectiations and we highly recommend this hotel for anyone who would like a romantic getaway to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Eohippus
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a few things in a hotel during our recent Paris trip: we wanted a hotel which was in a safe neighborhood, convenient for sightseeing, and quiet. We wanted a meticulously clean, modern hotel with a helpful staff. And, we didn't want to break the bank paying for these things. The Apostrophe Hotel met all of our criteria and then some. The hotel is located off Blvd Montparnasse on a tiny side street. The location off the boulevard means easy access to 3 different metro stops (representing two different lines, making most trips to restaurants and sights one transfer or less), but its positioning on the side street means the hotel is protected from most city noise. While it's true that you can hear the occasional police siren, and trash is collected on the side street daily (which could be heard from our room on the third floor) I found the hotel to be unusually quiet considering it was right in the middle of a big city. The hotel itself was perfect. There are 5 floors, with rooms decorated by theme on each floor. For every theme and on every floor, there are rooms in 3 different sizes. We chose the Pittoresque-sized, or middle-sized, room because it was only 10 or 15 Euros/night more than the smallest room. While not huge, there was room to walk around the bed, and it was so thoughtfully laid out with large shelves in the closet and handy ledges and tables, that we never really felt cramped. But the very best thing about this hotel was the staff. We couldn't have asked for more helpful hosts on our trip. We thank Laurent and Roman, especially, who helped us with directions, restaurant recommendations, and reservations at every opportunity. It made all the difference. (On a side note, if you do choose to stay here, consider a Boulangerie Julien for breakfast pastries or lunch sandwiches. Make a right out of the hotel, left at Notre Dame Des Champs, and then 3 blocks down at the corner of Rue Brea. Yum, and thanks to Laurent for the suggestion!)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel! Would recommend to anyone...”
Reviews.Author: drazworld
Reviews.Content: We really did our research before picking the hotel for our week long stay in Paris. We wanted a good location and good service at a fair price. We first found the Apostrophe in the NY Times and then looked at many reviews from different sites including TripAdvisor. This hotel is exactly what I expected. It is a half block from a main street (Montparnesse) and within 2 blocks of 3 metro stops. We took the RER from CDG airport and the hotel was several blocks from the Port Royal station. Easy walk. We arrived early in the morning and were very tired. Our room was not available yet, but the hotel offered us another clean room to take a rest. Awesome. They came to get us when our room was ready and we moved right in. Our French is terrible and this was not a problem here. Every morning we would come down and discuss our daily plans. Roman was great and his recommendations were spot on. Gino was our favorite night guy and he also had many good ideas and helped us with a good bottle of red wine one evening upon our return to the hotel. The rooms are on the small side, but it wasn't a problem at all. Rain shower was nice. Beds comfy. Everything was clean. This was an A+ experience and all I can say is LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this hotel. Everything we hoped for and more. Thank you Roman, Gino and Isabelle!

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality, kindness and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: Sic_roberto
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in a very nicely decorated room, not big but very comfortable. Free Wifi connection. Excellent Staff, always available, they make you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Good home base for Paris in the 6th Arr.”
Reviews.Author: Jedi8870
Reviews.Content: Small but well designed rooms on a quiet side street. Who stays in their room in Paris other than to sleep anyway? The shower has 6 cool water jets and a ceiling rain head as well as a hand spray. Near Montparnasse theaters, a fresh fish restaurant across the street from Le Dome bistro. Front desk staff was incredibly helpful with unique recommendations for dinner and macarons. The RER is a direct train from Charles de Gaulle that deposits you about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. We traveled with another couple and the small lobby was a good place for us to hang out. 20 mins walk to Musee d'Orsay, Notre Dame etc. This hotel is in the 6th arr but across Blvd Montparnasse is the 14th arr.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, cosy rooms, good area.”
Reviews.Author: whoistrm
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. Restaurant recommendation superb. Area good, as on quiet backstreet, main street had what you needed, also practically backs onto Luxembourg gardens. Very close to tube and to direct RER to CDG. Rooms small, but cosy, love the decoration. Perhaps pricey, but seemed good value by comparison to other alternatives. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Boutique Hotel with Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: MLD2000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very small, with only three guest rooms on each floor - one small (the Apostrophe room), one medium (the Pittoresque room), and one large (the Balneo room). The rooms are equally small - even the medium and large ones - even by Paris standards. Nevertheless, the rooms are well laid out, each with a unique - albeit somewhat funky - decor. Since I was traveling by myself on business, the room was sufficient, but I suspect it would have felt cramped for more than one person. Also, the services were a bit lacking - I ended up ironing my shirt for my business meeting on a towel laid out on top of the washer in the laundry room. Still, I couldn't help but like this hotel. Likely had to do with the incredible staff, all of whom went out of their way to be friendly and helpful... on my departure, this included the front desk person carrying my luggage two blocks to a taxi stand, where he proceeded to wait with me for about 10 minutes until a taxi arrived (he wanted to make sure I was able to get a taxi and also that the driver knew where to take me). In all my years of traveling, I don't believe I've ever come across a hotel that provided comparable customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service, very small room”
Reviews.Author: euroreiser
Reviews.Content: First the positives: the hotel's location is great -- very close to the underground, to a large number of great restaurants and yet very quiet. Service was great with very friendly / helpful staff. The room was clean and well decorated. The main negative for us was the overall size of the room, which is tiny! One can just about walk around the bed and unpacking/packing could only be accomplished on the bed itself. And anyone over 6 feet (1.80mtrs) would probably sleep with his/her feet sticking out of the bed. On the website everything looks a lot bigger that it is in reality. From the lobby to the rooms and bathroom, this is a very compact hotel. Finally at 170 Euros/night it is not cheap. So even in Paris I had expected a bit more from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: susie0206
Reviews.Content: What a great place! Our room was lovely , great shower, all the amenities.. and the location was very handy to the Montparnasse station. From the instant we stepped in, everyone was wonderfully friendly and helpful. This was particularly lucky for us since we were there as the strikes were affecting rail travel and needed information and advice.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, romantic and beautiful rooms with the most friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: silverfishWales_UK
Reviews.Content: Apostrophe is a sanctuary in the Montparnasse theatre area of Paris. It is a beautiful Parisian artistic building of great and unusual interest. The exquisite tree patterns painted on the exterior and beautiful lighting are eye catching indeed. The rooms are all unique and themed. We loved the blue walk in shower room and all the gorgeous lights, very romantic. The attention to detail was fantastic. Clean sheets and towels every day. Unlimited hot water and the most powerful shower with side jets ever experienced! Beautiful lighting in the bedroom, with LED's in the ceiling like the stars above. Staff were so friendly and accommodating. An experience we will never forget. A truely different, most friendly, individual hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here. It really is fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: Treadted2
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in to the moment we left, we loved every minute. I would get so excited at the end of the day to be able to return to our little oasis. First of all, yes, the rooms are small. But get over it, you're going to paris, you're not going to find large rooms. For the size, these rooms are superbly designed, and with a little organization, Space is hardly an issue. Although the room was tight, the shower was actually really comfortably sized, and the water spray system is uber luxurious. The staff are all incredibly nice and helpful. Nothing bad to say. We were lucky enough to be on the top floor with a view of the eiffel tower. If you are booking far enough in advance, try to request it! Its great! I will stay here again when I come back to paris!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: Scoutsperson
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel in Paris last week, and could not have been happier. It was in a great location, with lot's of places to eat nearby, great area for walking..very close to the Vavin Metro stop. The hotel staff was the friendliest and most helpful I have ever experienced. We were greeted warmly when we arrived, and the hospitality was strong the entire time. It felt like we were being welcomed into someone's home. The rooms were great as well. Our first night, we had a had a bathtub in the room, and no shower. It was a really nice bathtub with Jacuzzi jets, but we are more shower folks then bath. We asked to change to a room with a shower, and it was not a problem at all. The shower was awesome...rain shower with extra water spouts, and great water pressure. Oh and they had great amenities too! Most importantly it was a clean room and had a great bed. I'm a bot of a hotel snob, and I booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews that I had read...and cannot recommend it more! Cannot wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Petit et chic”
Reviews.Author: Mewsic
Reviews.Content: I expected to love this hotel. The website—different versions in French and English—were polished and informative. And the emails exchanged between booking and arrival were warm and helpful. Apostrophe does many things right—big and small: Each room is different. My room—V for voyageur—on the third floor was done in soft grays with deep red accents. The queen bed was comfortable and there was adequate storage space in the closets on each side of the bed. There were even enough hangars, which I appreciate as a business traveler. The lighting was excellent with overhead halogen lighting and additional LED lights on the bed for reading in bed. And the 2 large windows provided quite a bit of natural light. The room was one of the smallest I’ve stayed in, but the vanity area was open, and there were several tall mirrors, so the room looked a bit larger. The shower was fantastic with overhead rainshower and side jet sprays. The room was well maintained and very clean (except for a very slight mildew odor in the sink drain). The continental breakfast (in room or in the lobby) was plentiful and reasonably priced: do try to fresh juice smoothies made by the hotel staff. Desk service was simply wonderful. The gentlemen answered numerous questions for me and assisted me in getting restaurant reservations. They were unfailing cheerful and a pleasure to do business with. The hotel faces a small, quiet street just off the noisy Boulevard Raspail. When the windows were closed, the street noise was barely audible. The hotel is in the bustling Montparnasse area, within a 5-6 minute walk of two different metro lines. It’s easy to get to anywhere in Paris from here, and there are a number of cafes nearby as well as the Jardin de Luxembourg. There were a few negative aspects to my stay, but on balance they weren’t significant enough to keep me from coming back or from recommending this hotel to others. First, the entry/reception is dank, dark, and when I was there, smelled slightly of mildew. It doesn’t make a good first impression. Second, the room was small with very little area to work. If you are here as a tourist, that wouldn’t be a problem. The layout of the room, though, didn’t seem optimized for normal traffic flow. Third—and a major pet peeve of mine in many hotels—was the push-to-operate hair dryer. Annoying. Which is why I always bring my own. The last complaint is that on all three nights of my stay from about 11 or 11:30 at night and continuing for a couple of hours, the guests in the room next to mind played their music loud enough that I could hear it through the walls. Thumpa-thumpa-thump-squeal. Perhaps if I hadn’t had to get up early for meetings I wouldn’t have minded so much. The first night it was quite loud; I asked the front desk staff to ask the guests to turn it down and they did, but it was still audible. Noisy guests aren’t the hotel’s fault, but inadequate soundproofing or placing CD/DVD/MP3 players on the wall when a bed is placed on the other side of that wall is. As I said, these really were minor issues compared with a stay that was enjoyable overall.

Reviews.Title: “Small but great location, tasteful and very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: klare28
Reviews.Content: All hotels in Paris are small given what they cost but still just keep in mind...it's fine for a weekend stay but with a lot of luggage you might feel cramped - I'm referring to a regular room, don't know about the suites. Otherwise it's great. Location is good (close to public transport and many bars & cafes), staff is friendly and extremely helpful. Decor is stylish, bathrooms nice and shower was awesome. Beds were also super comfy albeit a little short.

Reviews.Title: “small is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Munby
Reviews.Content: Exterior of the hotel is strikingly painted with the image of a tree in shadow, which is a good clue to the high design standards once inside. Our room was small but cleverly planned, extremely comfortable. Breakfast choices were good and stylishly presented. Staff were very pleasant, made us feel very welcome. The side street is quiet but gives easy access to transport and good walking routes to the centre, and many local cafes. A good quarter for spotting artists' houses, small publishing houses and many tempting antiquarian bookshops - shame we don't read French well enough. The cemetery at Montparnasse is a local site worth exploring: we were intrigued by the votive offerings left at Serge Gainsbourg's tomb.

Reviews.Title: “A Magical little Gem tucked away in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DR-TO
Reviews.Content: Great little place tucked away on a small street near Luxembourg gardens in Paris. 15 minute walk from what i believe is the best walking part of paris (St. Germain/Latin Quarter, etc.). The staff here are truly amazing -- they have not been corrupted by "Parisien warmth" towards foreign tourists if you know what i mean. They care about each guest and really make you feel at home. Whether it was letting me use their internet/print out things, or making all the arrangements to mail me back a clothing article that I accidentally left in the room, they were a delight. Room was great too. Clean, modern, comfy. Tight living spaces, but hey this is Paris, not Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to staying there again”
Reviews.Author: AngelinaOber
