Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from 4 wonderful days in Paris. I stayed at the APOSTROPHE HOTEL It is very nice modern boutique-type hotel. The rooms are comfortable had wonderful art details The staff are friendly, attentive and they seem to anticipate your every wish. All that I can suggest is that next time that you are going to Paris you must stay at the APOSTROPHE HOTEL. Me i Looking forward to staying there again !

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Quaint with Personalized Service”
Reviews.Author: rwill85420
Reviews.Content: Several of us check into this quaint, trendy, themed boutique hotel. From the moment we arrived we were treated like very special guests. The daytime staff was especially attentive and personable. We recoived all the assistance we needed for our daily Paris adventures! The room were clean and modern. We could not have picked a better location and it located only a block from the subway (truly the best way to travel in Paris) and wonderful cafes and boutique shopping. I would recommend this hotel for anyone on pleasure travel to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value, fun rooms, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: vhoecke
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Apostrophe for 3 nights. I was traveling on business but my boyfriend was along for fun. The pros: - Immaculate, up-to-date, fresh and modern rooms. - Very comfortable bed, nice firm mattress, quality linens. - Extremely quiet hotel on a quiet little street - we never heard street noise and only once even heard other guests, since each floor only has 3 or 4 rooms on it. This is truly an intimate and unique boutique hotel. - Free wifi that was easy to access. - Stylish and fun room decor - we actually switched rooms during our stay after seeing a room across the hall, just to mix it up. Both had great style. - The beds have really nice headrests that make it comfortable to read or laptop in bed. - The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. They got us dinner reservations, oriented us to the neighborhood, and even helped me work up the courage to brave the Metro despite my lack of French! Kind and considerate in all things. This is a very small boutique hotel, so you see the same couple people each day and they take solicitous but not nosy interest in your day. Very few cons: - Rooms are quite compact, but space is well used. - The rooms either come with a. a wonderful shower with a large showerhead and several spray nozzles on the side, or b. a jetted tub that can be very relaxing I enjoy jetted tubs but like a spacious enclosed shower (sometimes a challenge when traveling in France). The room with tub only had a shower wand. So, if you love to take a stand up shower with showerhead above, request a room with a shower rather than a jetted tub. The showers are very nice. I would definitely recommend this hotel as an excellent value, a very comfortable and quiet place run by excellent people in a pleasant walking neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely: inspired design, friendly, attentive staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Campwatson
Reviews.Content: We completely enjoyed our stay @ Apostrophe. The hotel is beautifully designed cozy place. Our room had a lovely view and the shower was just amazing! Everything from the delicious morning breakfast, to the carefully prepared tea (the carafe in it's own little black zip up cozy!) to a glass of wine and a chat at days end was a delight. It all felt, we all felt special. I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ambience, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ellusionnl
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Paris. First off: maybe not the best location for first time visitors to Paris but we knew that when we booked just 2 days before arrival. Rooms are small (gotta love Paris) but very elegant. There's a nice calm but exciting ambience to the whole hotel. Bed's are a bit short if you're tall. Rooms were clean and the shower is great. The Rainshower with jets are a real treat after a long day of sightseeing and shopping. Staff is very friendly and helpful! Very attentive every time you enter or leave the lobby. Great job! It's very very good. A nice boutique hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: hist0rytraveller
Reviews.Content: We loved the place, the people, the breakfast, the room, and especially the shower. We plan to go back on our next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Nicko77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is unusual as it is so narrow (even though it feels spacious) but it works very well and my girlfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed our weekend there. We got the impression that the staff took great pride in the hotel and it was very well run. All facilities were very neat and clean with unique interior design. I don't think that I would recommend this hotel for a family as such but it is absolutely perfect for a couple on a weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. This is classy, charming, modern Paris.”
Reviews.Author: DevoraR
Reviews.Content: I am extremely picky when it comes to hotels in Paris. I love France and don't get to go often enough, so I want my experience to be top notch without spending $400 on a room. For this trip, I researched home exchanges, renting an apartment, and hundreds of hotels. I couldn't be happier that I landed on Apostrophe. I chose it because it's part of the Tablet Hotel collection and I'm usually very satisfied with their hotel look, feel and service. It was also an excellent price at 179 Euros a night. I arrived early, was given a place to leave my bags till the room was ready, and then discovered I'd been upgraded when I returned to check in. The room was small, but it was perfect for one person, and if you get along with the person you're traveling with, would be fine as well. The decor was neat: clouds and Parisian rooftops painted on the walls, a big window looking out onto the street, gorgeous tiles in the bathroom. But really, it was more than just the pleasant atmosphere: the bed was comfortable, the sheets and bedding were super clean, and the gorgeous bathtub worked perfectly, cycling through green and blue LED lights while massaging with bubble jets. The staff downstairs was also really kind; helpful with directions and very friendly which can be a relief in Paris. The only critique I have is that there was an area of tiles next to the bathtub which had a really bad grout job (strange to mention it, but it stood out in an otherwise superb hotel) and I would fix that if I were management. Otherwise, magnifique! Je reviens sans doute.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect!”
Reviews.Author: norway_cathy
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff, very warm and friendly. We always felt welcome, and they could always answer our questions. The rooms are wonderful; full of style and comfort. The shower must be pointed out probably as Paris' best shower!!! A plus for sound isolation - we slept like babies all the four nights. The cleanliness of the room was perfect, not a spot to see. Location is fantastic - right between the train station and the metro line 4. Also close to a shopping centre - Galeries La Fayette. Paris is amazing and Apostrophe hotel made our stay beyond perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Beautiful Hotel, Great Location and Very Nice People at the Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: awiearg
Reviews.Content: The people who work at the hotel are very friendly and very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Personal: A little luxury on a human scale”
Reviews.Author: jadorelesvoyages_11
Reviews.Content: L'Apostrophe Hotel is a wonderful little gem in a great location. Especially if you want a hotel where every guest is given individualized attention as a guest and if you appreciate a room with flair (not to be confused with size) you will enjoy this hotel. My room was very small, but no matter -- I fell asleep with the Eiffel tower peeking out over the rooftops and the massage shower was a treat. Also their continental breakfast is on par with neighborhood establishments and 6Euros is exceptionally reasonable to dine in. Merci et a la prochaine!

Reviews.Title: “Fanstastic Hotel...amazing shower and service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CANDORI
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Apostrophe for 10 days, since I am a solo traveler i stayed in smallest room, most amazing shower!! They bring your breakfast to your room and they paid so much attention to detail they even knew what breads to bring me and what jams I liked, I didn't even have to ask! Very clean and comfy bed!!! Lighting effects were really interesting, very modern and designer boutique like hotel. Perfect location to Vavin metro stop!!! They do have a wonderful stereo system and flat screen tv also, only negative.......my neighbors during my stay liked the stereo too much and played it way too loud all night long!!!! Owners and staff are WONDERFUL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Three Weeks at Apostrophe”
Reviews.Author: cw52
Reviews.Content: Lovely lovely lovely. The Jardin du Luxumbourg is your backyard, there are great bistros and restos nearby. The service is attentive and sweet. Very clean and comfortable rooms (the bed! oh the bed). I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Boutique”
Reviews.Author: londont9
Reviews.Content: Tucked away on a quiet street in the Latin Quarter near Jardins de Luxemburg this chic and boutique hotel is a perfect room away from home. Designers have done the most with the least amount of space, with the end result an artistic escape that fits nicely against a quiet backdrop. Definitely worth experiencing. Oh, and the staff were friendly and helpful. The new Paris is here.

Reviews.Title: “Great sets”
Reviews.Author: crastinut
Reviews.Content: Apostrophe is an unique hotel. I spend a week-end with my husband and we are both appreciated so much. Our room was charming, based on litterature and artistic themes. Moreover the hotel is very well located, close to everything. I really appreciate the fact that the bathroom aren't separate, it means that you can do everything in one piece, and the cloeseness are opening. The staff were very friendly. I wish I'll come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, if you know details of the room before hand”
Reviews.Author: roma01
Reviews.Content: Before I book a room I read up all about the hotel on different sites, look at the photo’s and read reviews, so there were no surprises for us. I think that if people not do this they could be in for a couple of disappointments like I have been reading here. My scores are quiet high but that is because it stood up to my expectations, I knew what I was booking. Wonderful friendly staff, 10 points here :-) Location: we have been many times to Paris but I think if it was a 1st visit I would say to people to go some-where ‘more in the hub’ of things. For us it was perfectly wonderful discovering an area of Paris where we had not been before. The Sunday market which is nearby is fantastic. Room: we stayed in the Paris Paradise where it is wonderful to sit in bed and be able to see the top part of the Eiffel Tower. You can really think ‘Hooray we are in Paris”. I knew the room would be small but even so when walking in it my first thought was ‘gosh it is small’. But the mural on the wall, the interior, just the general looks really makes up for it. The bed seems small at first but you need to know that you can take the large cushion off the bed and then you have a normal length. This is good to use when watching tv. We found the bed extremely comfortable. The ‘bathroom’: well as you can read here there is not one but actually that is why I choose this room, it was wonderful to relax in bath with a book while my other half was lying in bed watching tv or reading. I would say to people who are not average sized with their weight to be aware that the bath is not of a wide type, the length is fine. Having a separate toilet is a plus point here, who likes to relax in bath while your other half needs to go… Actually I found the toilet space to be the average size of toilets here in The Netherlands, so I suppose it is what you are used to what your thoughts are. I think for a special occasion this is a wonderful hotel. I would recommend this hotel but only if I knew the people would enjoy this type of room.

Reviews.Title: “Eccentric loveliness in a great district”
Reviews.Author: shinyredheart
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our wedding anniversary and had a wonderful time. The room was small but perfectly formed, and it was well equipped to a high standard (great bed and shower/basin). The night manager was amazing, and we enjoyed a drink (or two!) and great conversation one night with him in the little bar area in the entrance. The blue RER line is up the road - very handy for the airport. The neighbourhood is lovely, too, and you're never far from a Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Original but impractical”
Reviews.Author: voyageurMTLAH
Reviews.Content: Very original design to this hotel, but badly executed. We stayed one night in a Balnéo room (the largest) in Oct. 09, but moved after the first night. The room had no bathroom (a toilet in a closet), the promised tourbillon jacuzzi bath was next to the bed, splashing it and our bags when we tried it out. No shower other than a handheld, again splashing all over, and the room (as is common in Paris) so small that there was nowhere to put bags except jammed between the bed and the wall --- and this is the largest-style room. Room and lobby very dimly lit like a nightclub, which is fun for a suite party but awful during the day. And then some logistics problems: the stereo was broken but the staff just shrugged when we asked; a power socket came out of the wall when I pulled out a charger; and there was no iron available to press clothes, except for use downstairs in their own linens room. Staff were great, very nice all around, but a bit clueless on the stereo and iron. Also -- not really anywhere near central St-Germain, quite a walk. We are young design lovers, but for all the hassles and compared to other boutique hotels I have enjoyed in Paris, not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “No separate bathroom ruined it for me”
Reviews.Author: SJ13London
Reviews.Content: If you are contemplating booking this hotel, be very sure that you are comfortable with there being no separate bathroom. The shower and basin are actually in the room. The hotel's website doesn't make this clear, which I think is misleading. There is a very small cupboard for the loo. The hotel room was incredibly small, which I appreciate is standard for Paris, but is very difficult when you then have to contend with the shower and basin being at the foot of your bed - it makes it quite claustrophobic. The room was beautifully decorated, although not much thought had been given to storage - there was a tiny wardrobe with a few shelves in, but this was the only storage. It's a shame really, as the decor was nice, and the staff were generally polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “cool design + comfy bed + best service = perfect”
Reviews.Author: ido_m22
Reviews.Content: very cool design! the hotel is close to the center, 1 min away is the metro/parking. outside there is the by\bicycle (velib) and the bed....very hard to wake up :)
